intro: Alysicarpus nummularius, commonly known as the silverleaf sida, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with a silvery underside. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by spherical, dry fruits known as nuts. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
